ace_zero.agents.fsm_agent.stern_conversion module¶

This module contains subclasses of StateAgent that represent the discrete states in a stern conversion operation. The class SternConversionAgent should be initialised to generate a new stern conversion agent for execution.

class ace_zero.agents.fsm_agent.stern_conversion.Converting(states=[], params_filename=None, initial=None, auto_initial=True)[source]¶

Bases: ace_zero.agents.fsm_agent.state_agent.StateAgent

State to turn aircraft to match a threat aircraft’s heading to maintain a rear-hemisphere position.

During execution commands are issued to turn the aircraft to match the threat aircraft heading. In the special case where the headings are exactly reciprocal, commands are initially issued to turn toward the threat aircraft itself to ensure that the turn is in the correct direction.

If no threats are detected the state requests a transition back to the default state.

NO_CLOSER_RANGE = 2.0¶
execute(t, dt)[source]¶

class ace_zero.agents.fsm_agent.stern_conversion.FlyRelativeBearing(states=[], params_filename=None, initial=None, auto_initial=True)[source]¶

Bases: ace_zero.agents.fsm_agent.state_agent.StateAgent

State to fly at a constant bearing relative to the threat aircraft.

On entry to this state a command is issued to turn the aircraft a predetermined angle relative to the threat aircraft. When the turn has been completed the aircraft will continue to fly on this bearing to increase lateral separation, until the desired displacement has been achieved.

If the desired displacement has been achieved the state requests a transition to the FlyingOffset state. If no threats are detected the state requests a transition back to the default state.

DESIRED_DISPLACEMENT = 5000¶
TURN_ANGLE = 15.0¶

class ace_zero.agents.fsm_agent.stern_conversion.FlyingOffset(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: ace_zero.agents.fsm_agent.state_agent.StateAgent

State to fly parallel to a threat aircraft to maintain constant separation.

On entry to this state a command is issued to turn the aircraft to fly parallel to the flight path of the threat aircraft. When the turn has been completed the aircraft will continue to fly on this heading to maintain lateral separation, until the conversion point has been reached. Note that the state does not currently check whether the heading is still parallel to the threat flight path; if the threat changes heading the lateral separation will change.

If the defined conversion point has been reached the state requests a transition to the Converting state. If no threats are detected the state requests a transition back to the default state.

CONVERSION_RANGE = 1.0¶

class ace_zero.agents.fsm_agent.stern_conversion.PureIntercept(states=[], params_filename=None, initial=None, auto_initial=True)[source]¶

Bases: ace_zero.agents.fsm_agent.state_agent.StateAgent

Default state for a stern conversion manoeuvre.

This state intercepts a target by pointing the aircraft nose directly at it. During execution the relative bearing to the threat is calculated and commands are issued to turn the aircraft to fly toward it.

If an enemy is detected within the defined turn range the state requests a transition to the FlyRelativeBearing state.

TURN_RANGE = 15.0¶

class ace_zero.agents.fsm_agent.stern_conversion.SternConversionAgent(params_filename=None)[source]¶

Bases: ace_zero.agents.fsm_agent.state_agent.StateAgent

This class represents an agent that performs a stern conversion manoeuvre against a target aircraft.

To execute a stern conversion correctly the aircraft must be in the forward quarter of the threat aircraft at the beginning of the operation. If the target aspect angle is too great the agent will not be able to achieve the correct lateral separation to execute the manoeuvre.
